dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH DAY
dialogues.text: (V. O): Is that why Daddy died? From the curse? Aunt Frances (V.O): Yes, my darling. Aunt Frances (V.O): Your mother knew She heard  the beetles ticking for your father's death all day  long. She knew that when you hear the sound of the deathw beetle the man you love is doomed to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances (V.O): That's how you came to live  with us. You tucked you into our lives then. We've raised you the best way we know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet (V.O): In this house we have chocolate  cake for breakfast. We never bother with silly things  like bedtimes or brushing our teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances (V.O): But with the sweets comes  the sour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet (V.O): So when you find yourself the  center of attention

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gillian: Hi! You want to play? Aunt Jet (V.O): It's not that they hate you.  It's that, well... We're different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls: You witch! Witch, witch! You're a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Gillian, Sally. The only curse in  this family is sitting there at the end of the table.  Your Aunt Fanny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Oh come on. You have to admit that  any man who gets involved with an Owens woman is bound  to end up 6 feet under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Spare me. Aunt Frances: What about my poor Ethan? Aunt Jet: Fate. Aunt Frances: Accident. Young Sally: Mommy died of a broken heart, didn't  she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: Yes, my darling girl, she did. Aunt Jet: My little witch. Let's go inside and  do some spells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Sally: What about my homework? Aunt Jet: Pish! Tosh! You'll both learn things  in the house. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Sally: Come on Gilly. Young Gillian: I'm coming, Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Very good, Sally. You've been blessed  with a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gillian: What about me? Aunt Frances: We don't worry about you, Gilly-  Bean. Your talents will emerge in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Sally, you just stay right there.  Keep working on your spells. Just keep working on your  spells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Get the bird. Aunt Frances: Get the book. A woman: I want him so much, I can't think about  anything else. I don't sleep. He has to leave his wife.  He has to leave her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Perhaps you might find one better  suited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman: I don't want anyone else. He's all  I think about. Why the hell else would I come here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: Take the money, Jet. A woman: I want him to want me so much he can't  stand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Be careful what you wish for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Sally: I hope I never fall in love. I  hope I never fall in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gillian: I can't wait to fall in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Sally: " He will hear my call a mile  away. He will whistle my favorite song. He can ride  a pony backwards."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gillian: What are you doing? Young Sally: Summoning up a true love spell.  called Amas Veritas. " He can flip pancakes in  the air. He'll be marvelously kind. And his favorite  shape will be a star. And he'll have one green eye and  one blue."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gillian: Thought you never wanted to fall  in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Sally: That's the point. The guy I dreamed  of doesn't exist. And if he doesn't exist, I'll never  die of a broken heart. And if he doesn't exist, I'll  never die of a broken heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Get the door. Sal, you have no idea. Sally: Do you love him enough to marry him? Gillian: Oh, come on, Sal, What's enough? I  hate it here. I want to go where no one's even heard  of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: I feel like I'll never see you again. Gillian: Of course you will. You can see me  again. We'll grow old together. It'll be you and me  living in a big house. These 2 old biddies with all  these cats. I bet we even die on the same day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: You swear? Gillian: (to her boyfriend) Honey! I need your  pocketknife. (to Sally) Here. My blood. Your blood.  Our blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: Good morning. Hello, boys. Charlie!  Looking good! God, what was I thinking? Oh, Franny,  let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Oh My goodness, Gillian's in Orlando!  (to Sally) She's in Orlando!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: I guess the Roto-Rooter man's  history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Well, according to that. Sally: This is insane. She keeps going through  all these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: Hopefully, someday she'l find  a guy who'll go through her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Hello, darling, How are you? Aunt Frances: Oh, Jet, just give it up. Aunt Jet: Never. Sally: God, I miss her. Aunt Jet: Oh, sweetie! Oh, dear. Aunt Frances: Oh, Samson! Now, just knock it  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: All I want is a normal life. Aunt Frances: My darling girl, when are you  going to understand that "normal" is not necessarily  a virtue? It rather denotes a lack of courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Well, it's what I want. Aunt Jet: See this couple? He's having an affair  with the babysitter. And she can eat a cake in under  a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: What time is it? Aunt Frances: Any moment now. (to Sally) Where  are you going, dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Most excellent. Sally (VO): Dear Gillian, Today is our third  anniversary and all I have to show for it are 2 beautiful little girls and a husband I just can't stop kissing.  I don't even mind the beard. I wish you could see us.  No more stones being thrown, no taunts cried out. Everyth is just so blissfully normal. Life is perfect. Dear  Sal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian (V.O.) I'm lying in the sun. I'm hanging  by the pool. I've got a million friends. You might say  that life is perfect. But I don't care about any of  it. In fact, I only have 2 words to say to you: Jimmy  Angelvo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael: Hey, boys, catch anything today? Boys: Not much. Michael: See you in a bit. Hey, Jimmy, What's  going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sally hears the beetles ticking) Sally: I hear you. Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael: How's Mary doing? She good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sally looks for the beetle) Sally: That's can't be. No! I know you're in  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman: Michael, look out! A man: Look out behind you! On your right! ( A truck hit Michael)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: It was the curse, wasn't it? He died  because I loved him so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: My poor little girl. We had no  idea when we cast the spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: What spell? What are you talking about?  Oh, You didn't. Please tell me that my own flesh and  blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: It was just a little push. You wanted  so much to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: We never expected that you'd truly  love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Well, I did. And I want him back. You  brought him into my life. You bring him back! I have  never asked you for anything ! I never asked for spells,  but do this! You can bring him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: No, dear. You don't do that! Aunt Frances: You don't do that. Sally: You can do this. I know you can. I remamber.  I found here when Mommy and Daddy died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: Even if we did bring him back,  it wouldn't be Michael. It'd be something else. Something dark and unnatural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: I don't care what he comes back as. As  long as he comes back. Please do this for me. Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sally comes aunt's house with her two chirdren) Sally (V.O) : This is only temporary, don't  get too comfortable. There'll be no chocolate for breakfa Homework will be done after dinner teeth and hair brushed before bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: And as for you two my children will never  do magic. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie: Mom? It's time for us to go to school.  Mommy. It's the same time as yesterday and the day before that, and the day before that. Out of bed, sleepyhead!  I'm worried about Antonia. Do you know she puts on her  mouse ears, she drives around town all liquored up.  Naked! All right. I'll see you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Come here, you! I'm sorry, baby. I'm  just so tired

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie:It's okay, Mommy. Sally: Gilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Sally. Jimmy: I was just thinking about you. Gillian: You are always thinking about me. Honey,  I just have to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy: Let's go together. Gillian: Jimmy, come on. Jimmy: I'm just kidding. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gillian came home) Sally: I was really, really happy. Sally We  were going to open a botanical shop. Michael'd get the  ingredients. And I'd make the stuff. He really loved  my mint-oatmeal shaving cream. He couldn't stop eating  it. I'm sure all this is really boring to you. But he  really made me lough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Angelov? What kind of name is that? Gillian: Bulgarian. Sally: Bulgarian? Gillian: Huh, huh. He's from somewhere near  Transylvania. He has this whole Dracula-cowboy thing  about him. He's just so intense. I mean, he talks about  our rerationship in terms of centuries. Sometimes we  just stay up all night worshipping each other like bats.  Thank God for Jet's belladonna or I'd never get any  sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Why are you taking that stuff? Gillian: I'm not using it. I just give it to  him every now and then. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: So you're drugging your boyfriend to  get a little shut-eye? Doesn't that seem strange to  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Maybe. And he's strong. So much stronger  than me. He can survive the curse. Do you forgive our  mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Sometimes. Gillian: You'll never forgive yourself unless  you get up and you get dressed and brush your teeth,  because your breath stinks and you take care of those  little girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Yeah. You're right. Gillian: I love you. Sally: I love you too, Gilly-Bean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy: How's your wicked mommy doing? Children: Witch! Witch! You're a witch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think, after 300 years, they'd make up a better  ryme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mother: Really, you troublemaker started this. Kylie: I hate you! Sally: Put the finger down, Kylie. Kylie: I hope you get chikenpox. Sally: She was just kidding. Antonia: No, she wasn't, Mom. She was not kidding. Sally: What's wrong with you? We do not cast  and we do not toy with people's lives. Do you understand? This is not a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie: No, you don't cast. You probably couldn't  even if you tried! She has all this power and doesn't  use it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antonia: I think you really hurt Mom's feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antonia: Kylie thinks any man who marries us  is going to croak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: That's such hogwash. What about  your grandparents, Jack and Regina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie: grandma Regina died of broken heart,  didn't she? How could she do that? Leave Mom and Aunt  Gilly behind when they were just little girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antonia: Why won't she talk about it? Kylie: Was Mama good at spells as a girl? Why  won't she do spells now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: What's going on in here? Aunt Frances: Nothing. Aunt Jet: Just making toast, is all. Sally: Did you guys finish your homework? As  stom's coming. Go check the windows for me, Okay. (To  Aunt Frances) Making toast? I want you both to watch  what you say to those girls. I don't you filling their  heads with any of your nonsense, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: We'd never tell them nonsense, dear. Sally: Good night, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sally writes letter to Gillian) Sally (V.O.) Dearest, Gilly. Sometimes I feel  there's a hole inside me an emptiness that, at times  seems to burn. I think if you lifted my heart to your  ear, probably you could hear the ocean. And the moon  tonight, there's a circle around it. A sign of trouble  not far behind. I have this dream of being whole. Of  not going to sleep each night, wanting. But still, someti when the wind is warm or the crickets sing I dream of  a love that even time will lie down and be still for.  I just want someone to love me. I want to be seen. I  don't know. Maybe I've had my happiness. I don't want  to believe it but there is no man, Gilly only that moon.  (Phone rings) Gillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: It's Gillian. Sally: I know. Sally: What's wrong? Gillian: I'm scared. Can you come and get me? Sally: Where are you? I'm taking the first flight  out. Watch the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Just go to Gilly. The children'll  be fine. We'll take them to the solstic celebration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Why can't you two just stay here?  Aunt Frances: We can't back out. We're on the  committee. We are presenting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Fine. But I don't want them dancing naked  under the full moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: No, of course not, dear. Nudity is  entirely optional, as you well remember!

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gillian: The room service here sucks. Sally: Let's get you out of here. Gillian: I'm fine. Gillian: He's been really crazy, you know? We've  been driving for 2 weeks straight. I mean, not even  straight. In these zigzags, back and forth. Damn these  shose! Then today he says he wants a jelly doughnut.  An he says to the kid, "Jelly doughnut, with cream."  And the kid looked confused. And I said, "Jimmy,  jelly's not a cream." And then the kid laughed  and I laughed and then he punched me. He punched me  real hard. The bastard! Blood on the moon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: I know. Gillian: Blood on the moon! Sally: I know. Get in the car. Gillian: Where's my tiger's eye? It brings me  luck. I left it. I got to get my tiger's eye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: It's probably in the bag, Gilly! Gillian,  come on!

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jimmy: You drive. Jimmy: You want some? Nope. Hey, Sally, you  ever read any books by Louis L'Amour? Okay, Louis L'Amour is a foreigner and he loved all things cowboy. Just  like me, Jimmy-boy. So Louis would write stories about  rustlers. Rustlers who were really bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: (To Sally)The belladonna is in my bag. Jimmy: They would try to steal the cattle. But  before they could sell them they would try to take away  the brand of the owner with an acid, or by scrubbing.  Unfortunately, they could never get rid of it. So they  would be caught and get hanged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: What are you doing? Jimmy: Come on! You can't hide the brand. It's  just you and me. (To Sally) Watch the road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Shut up! Rustlers and branding! Louis  L'Amour by the way is not a foreigner! He's from Noth  Dakota, you asshole! Jimmy: Watch the road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: You're freaking ne out, Dracula freak!  Give me the bottle before I plow you into a truck just  to get you to shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy: Calm down! You know, girls. I'm feeling  very into sisters right now.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROAD NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jimmy: (Singing) You were always on my mind,  you were always on my mind...

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gillian: He should've passed out by now. You  don't give him enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: I gave him plenty. Gillian: What's he going to do? Sally: Just stay calm. (Jimmy gets into the car) Jimmy: (Singing) If I made you feel second best,  I'm so sorry, I was blind. you were always on my mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Jimmy, please, baby. Come on, baby,  I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy: I'm sorry, my love. I want to be with  you forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: I love you. Jimmy, please. Gillian: Sal, He's out. He's passed out. Sally: Oh, God! Gillian: Oh, My God! How much did you give him? Sally: I don't know, you know, I wasn't using  a measuring cup! He tried to kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Please, God, if you get us out of this,  I'll be good. I'll have babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: I have babies, Gillian. I had normal.  And I worked really hard to get that normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: It's all my fault, Sally. I didn't  mean to ruin your life. I just had no one else to turn  to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Get in the car. Get in the car. We have  to go to the police. It was self-defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: The old slowly-poison-him-to-death  self-defense? Come on, Sally, they're never going to  believe us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: You really should stop smoking so much. Gillian: Why? Sally: I'll probably get life. I should smoke  two at once. It'll shorten the sentence. I really don't  want to lose my children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: I know. I don't want you to either. Sally: What are you thinking? Gillian: When Muchael died, you asked the aunts  to bring him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: But they wouldn't. Gillian: Wouldn't. but couldn't. Sally: No, They were right. He'd come back as  something dark and unnatural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Jimmy already is dark and unnatural.  I don't care what he comes back as.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: No, that is not an option. That is not  a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: We don't have a choice, Sally! This  is our choice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: You owe me big-time. Gillian: Watch his balls. Sally: You watch them (Jimmy's on the table) Gillian: Okay, Jimmy, I will get you out of  this but when I do, we are definitely breaking up. It  is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: What are you doing? Gillian: Nothing. Sally: Are you sure you want to do this. Gillian: Absolutely. (They cast spells) Sally: "Lips pursed, emit wind over tongue  in motion, teeth on edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Good enough, good enough. Sally: "Touch bounded smudge of blue sage  with braided wheat staw. insert needles through eyes  of corpse."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Through the eye? Sally: n the eye. No way. Gillian: I think we should wait for the aunts. Sally:It's not like he's going to stay fresh.  It's now or never. I need for you to get me something  white to write on top of the star. Chop-chop! This is  good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Wakey-wakey! Sally: Midnight margaritas! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: I see a man in your future and  he is gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: He's big. But you're scared to death  and you wind up like a frigid old hag. With your two  frigid old hag aunts. I don't know where that came from.  That was weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: She's never been interested in her  gifts. She just made that all up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: Don't lie. Gillian has her own  magic. And we all know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Oh, please. Since when is being a slut  a crime in this family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: What would you know about it? Aunt Frances: When we put that spell on you  for Michael we had to bind it with molasses just to  get your legs to open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: You self-centered shrew! Aunt Jet: Igrate! Gillian: Witch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: A lesson they must learn on their  own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: What about the little ones? Aunt Frances: Not to worry, Jetty. A good piece  of Maria's hanging rope will protect them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: You must promise us you won't take  them off. Not until we come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: We'll only be gone a short while. Aunt Jet: Do you hear us? Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: It was a very personal letter. Gary Hallet: Yes, ma'am, it was. Gillian: Hello, there. Gary Hallet: I'm not going to beat around the  bush. I need to find your boyfriend, James Angelvo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: I don't know where he is. I wouldn't  exactly call him my boyfriend. He's more like a bug  mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: Is that his handiwork there? Gillian: If a man hits me, he only does it once.  Can I take a peek at your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antonia: you came for breakfast. Gary Hallet: I just came to talk to your mom. Antonia: Great! She's having pancakes, too.  Do you have a gun? Can I see it? (To Sally) He's here  for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: I have a question or two.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KITCHEN MORNING
dialogues.text: Antonia: He's going to stay! Gillian: Oh, good! Good work. Now go back out  there and keep them away from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Berradonna. It's a sedative. People put  it in their tea to relax, calm their nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: Some people also use it as a poison. Sally: Witch people. Gary Hallet: Witch people. Witches. Sally: I guess you found me out, huh? Gary Hallet: Yes, I did. Sally: You should come here on Halloween. You'd  really see something. We all jump off the roof and fly.  We kill our husband too. Or is that outside your jurisdic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: Do you have any idea how strange  this all sounds to me? I got people telling me you're  here cooking up placenta bars you're into devil worship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: No, there's no devil in the craft. Gary Hallet: So what kind of a craft do you  do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Do I do? I manufacture bath oils and  soaps and hand lotions and shampoo. And the aunts ..  they like to meddle in people's love lives. Magic isn't  just spells and potions. Your badge , it's just a star,  Just another symble. Your talisman. It can't stop ciminal in their tracks, can it? It has power because you believe it does. Wish you could believe in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: Miss Owens, are you hiding James  Angelov?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Not in this house. Gary Hallet: Did you or your sister kill James  Angelov?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Oh, Yeah. Couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Antonia, could you make more of a mess? Antonia: Mom, I'm cooking. Sally: I can see that.  Gary Hallet: Hey, there. Did you ever seen a  saguaro cactus? Step aside, you. Well, you are about  to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gary cooks.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: I assume you don't want pancakes. Kylie: No, we want them! W e want them! Sally: Be careful. They tend to use those as  Frisbees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie: Can you ride a pony backwards? Gary Hallet: Backwards, forwards, sideways,  you name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Okay, first troll. Antonia: Look! Kylie: A star! Sally: This is not yours. Gary Hallet: That's all right. Sally: Second troll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: We just stick to our stories. No body,  no crime. I'm sorry. I'm feeling like shit. I'm not  sleeping. I . Me. Mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: That's all you can think about, isn't  it? You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: It's all about you. I don't want to  fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Don't walk away from me. I'm sick and  tired of cleaning up your messes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Yeah, you are right. You are always  right. I'm just a mess. Just one big mess! At least  I've lived my life. You hate me for it because it scares  the hell out of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Gillian, I don't hate you. Gillian: look at you! You spend all your energy  trying to fit in, be normal! But you'll never fit in.  Because we're different! And so are your girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: You leave them out of this. Okay? Gillian: All my life, I've wished I had half  your talent. You're wasting yourself, Sal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: I want you out of here. I want you done. Gillian: Okay, fine. I'm gone. Sally: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: What was that, Sally? That was  him, wasn't it? Is he gone or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Yes, you killed his spirit, but I know  I took his life. I'll tell you all need to know. I'll  tell you how I did it, where I buried him, what I did  it with. I'll tell you how

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: Wow, wow wow, Hold on just a goodamn  second, all right? One step at a time. I took on oath  to uphold the law. I came here to bring in the bad guy  because generally that's what I do. You asked me how  many times I read your letter. I must've read it about  a thousand times. I know now, It was your letter anything else that brought me here. It was you. And I'm all mixed- about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: The reason you're here and you don't  know why is because I sent for you. When I was a little  girl, I worked a spell so I would never fall in love.  I asked for qualities in a man that I knew couldn't  possibly exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: One green eye, one blue? Sally: But you do. Gary Hallet: You're saying what I'm feeling  is just one of your spells?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Yeah. It's not real. And if you stay,  I wouldn't know if it was because of the spell and you  wouldn't know if it was because I didn't want to go  to prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: You know, all relationships have  problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: I'm right, aren't I? You don't know,  do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Hallet: Why don't you do what you do and  what I do. and we'll see where we end up. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Okay. Gary Hallet: Curses only have power when you  believe in them. And I don't. You know what? I wished  for you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian (James inside): I'm feeling very into  sisters right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Come on! (Aunts and children comes back home) Aunt Jet: It seems we've not arrived in the  nick of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: I see our instincts are getting  a little rusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: He's squatting inside her like a toad.  This is what comes from dabbling. You can't practice  witchcraft while you look down your nose at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: I know. Just tell me what to do and I'll  do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: We must banish him. Aunt Jet: Force his spirit back to the grave. Aunt Frances: We need a full coven. Nine women. Aunt Jet: Twelve's better Aunt Frances: Do you have any friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sally calls on the phone) Sally: Linda, it's Sally. I'm activating the  phone tree. You know the stuff everyone whispers about  me... the hexes, the spells? Here is the thing. I'm  a witch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman D: I got the best news. Sally just came  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman A: What a fabulous affirmation. Woman F: Her sister just got out of a bad relationship  and now the guy won't leave her alone. Can you bring  a bloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie: I see headlights. Antonia: Mom, they're here! Come on ! They're  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman F: It's in the kitchen! Antonia: In the side door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Come in! It's so good of you to come.  No, now's not time to be shy. Come on in. Grab yourselves a spoon. You can stir right over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: You get right over here and grab  that spoon and dig right in. Doesn't that look great?  And the fumes are great for the pores. Not to mention  sealing his nasty spirit back into the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman A: Once, I was across town, my daughter  had a nightmare. I swear, I could hear her crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet:There's a little witch in all of us. Sally: Everything's almost ready, Aunt Jet.  (to Sara) I didn't expect to see you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara: Ever since I was a girl, I've wanted to  see inside your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Thank you for coming. Woman F: Is this okay? It's all I had. Aunt Frances: Well, ladies, let's begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: All right, ladies, pick a broom  from a circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman A: Holy shit! Woman B: I've been strung out by a guy before,  but this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Jet: Would each of you pick up your brooms?  Hold them at staff length, handle to brush. Remember  that as we go forth. It is only with our hearts beating  as one that we can save the life of this child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Aunt Frances starts spelling) Woman C: Are we supposed to say this? (Everyone spells to get rid of James's spirit from  Gillian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Stop it! We're killing her. Gillian (James): Fight this, you bitch! Sally: Oh, God! Oh, God! Gilly! Gilly, Honey! Gillian: It's okay. I love you. Sally: Stay with me. Gillian: Please, just let him take me. Sally: No, you have to hold on. Gill, you have  to stay with me. Gilly, No, stay with me. Gilly, No,  stay with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: No, he wants me. Just me. Everyone  will be safe. Just let him take me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Don't die on me, Gilly Owens, please.  Because we're supposed to die together, remember? The  same time. You promised me that. And this is not that  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: I love you, Sally. Sally: Okay, wait. I've got it. Get them back  in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally: Hey, Jimmy, I got a worm with your name  on it. You thirsty? Is this is what you want? Well,  this ...you can't have. My blood. Your blood. Our blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Frances: Maria's blood. Now! Push her in. Sally: I love you, Gillian. Woman A: We did it. Aunt Frances: Hands up. ladies. Ashes to ashes,  dust to dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman C: I wonder if that would work on my ex-husband? Woman A: Come on, ladies, let's clean house! Sally: Through kitchen. Follow me. Woman A: Well done. Sally: Sweep him to the roses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: Hey! There's something for you. Sally: From Arizona. Sally (V.O.): "Dear Miss Owens: Any further  investigations. Office hereby concluded James Angelvo's  cause of death was accidental. Jewely in ashes of structu provided positive indentification. Sincerely, Gary Hallet special investigator."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian: I don't think he's in there, Sal. Sally: What would you do, Gilly? Gillian: What wouldn't I do for the right guy? (Gary Hallet comes and kisses Sally.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally (V.O.): Can love travel back in time and  heal a broken heart? Was it our joined hands that finally lifted Maria's curse? I'd like to think so. There're  some things I know for certain. Always throw spilled  salt over your left shoulder. Keep rosemary by your  garden gate. Plant lavender for luck. And fall in love  whenever you can.
